net.kuujo.vertigo

Interface Vertigo<T extends Component<T>>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The current component instance type.

    public interface Vertigo<T extends Component<T>>
    The primary Vertigo API.

    This is the primary API for creating Vertigo networks and component instances. If the current Vert.x verticle is a Vertigo component, the Vertigo object will contain the component's InstanceContext as well as the concrete component instance. If the current Vert.x verticle is not a Vertigo component, this API can be used to create and deploy Vertigo networks.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Method Detail

      • isComponent

        boolean isComponent()
        Indicates whether the current Vertigo instance is a component instance. If this is a component instance then the component will be available via the component method.
        Returns:
        Whether the current instance is a component.

      • component

        T component()
        Gets the current component instance. The component instance is automatically constructed by Vertigo. This ensures type and connection safety in Vertigo component instances. Each Vert.x verticle may only represent a single Vertigo component instance, and this is that instance.
        Returns:
        The current component instance. If the current Vertigo instance is not a component then this value will be null.

      • config

        org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject config()
        Gets the component configuration. This configuration is also available via the Vert.x container.
        Returns:
        The component configuration. If the current Vertigo instance is not a component then this value will be null.

      • context

        InstanceContext<T> context()
        Gets the current component instance context. The instance context contains information about the current component instance, the defined component configuration, and the overall network structure, including event bus addresses, connections, and more.
        Returns:
        The current component instance context.If the current Vertigo instance is not a component then this value will be null.

      • createNetwork

        Network createNetwork(String address)
        Creates a new network.
        Parameters:
        address - The network address.
        Returns:
        A new network instance.

      • deployLocalNetwork

        Vertigo<T> deployLocalNetwork(Network network)
        Deploys a network within the current Vert.x instance.

        This deployment method uses the basic LocalCluster cluster implementation to deploy network verticles and modules using the current Vert.x Container instance.

        Parameters:
        network - The network to deploy.
        Returns:
        The called Vertigo instance.

      • deployLocalNetwork

        Vertigo<T> deployLocalNetwork(Network network,
                            org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<NetworkContext>> doneHandler)
        Deploys a network within the current Vert.x instance.

        This deployment method uses the basic LocalCluster cluster implementation to deploy network verticles and modules using the current Vert.x Container instance.

        Parameters:
        network - The network to deploy.
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called once deployment is complete. The handler will be called with the deployed network context which contains information about the network's component locations and event bus addresses.
        Returns:
        The called Vertigo instance.

      • shutdownLocalNetwork

        Vertigo<T> shutdownLocalNetwork(NetworkContext context)
        Shuts down a local network.
        Parameters:
        context - The context of the network to shutdown.
        Returns:
        The called Vertigo instance.

      • shutdownLocalNetwork

        Vertigo<T> shutdownLocalNetwork(NetworkContext context,
                              org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Shuts down a local network.
        Parameters:
        context - The context of the network to shutdown.
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called once the shutdown is complete.
        Returns:
        The called Vertigo instance.

      • deployRemoteNetwork

        Vertigo<T> deployRemoteNetwork(String address,
                             Network network)
        Deploys a network via the Vert.x event bus. Deployment is performed using a RemoteCluster instance which communicates module and verticle deployments over the event bus rather than performing deployments directly using the Vert.x Container.C
        Parameters:
        address - The address to which to communicate component deployments. This address will receive message-based commands which contain information on which modules or verticles to deploy. It is up to the handler at this address to assign those deployments to specific Vert.x instances or otherwise handle deployments via the Vert.x Container.
        network - The network to deploy.
        Returns:
        The called Vertigo instance.

      • deployRemoteNetwork

        Vertigo<T> deployRemoteNetwork(String address,
                             Network network,
                             org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<NetworkContext>> doneHandler)
        Deploys a network via the Vert.x event bus. Deployment is performed using a RemoteCluster instance which communicates module and verticle deployments over the event bus rather than performing deployments directly using the Vert.x Container.
        Parameters:
        address - The address to which to communicate component deployments. This address will receive message-based commands which contain information on which modules or verticles to deploy. It is up to the handler at this address to assign those deployments to specific Vert.x instances or otherwise handle deployments via the Vert.x Container.
        network - The network to deploy.
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called once deployment is complete. The handler will be called with the deployed network context which contains information about the network's component locations and event bus addresses.
        Returns:
        The called Vertigo instance.

      • shutdownRemoteNetwork

        Vertigo<T> shutdownRemoteNetwork(String address,
                               NetworkContext context)
        Shuts down a network via the Vert.x event bus.
        Parameters:
        address - The address to which to communicate component undeployments. This address will receive message-based commands which contain information on which modules or verticles to deploy. It is up to the handler at this address to assign those deployments to specific Vert.x instances or otherwise handle deployments via the Vert.x Container.
        context - The context of the network to shutdown.
        Returns:
        The called Vertigo instance.

      • shutdownRemoteNetwork

        Vertigo<T> shutdownRemoteNetwork(String address,
                               NetworkContext context,
                               org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Shuts down a network via the Vert.x event bus.
        Parameters:
        address - The address to which to communicate component undeployments. This address will receive message-based commands which contain information on which modules or verticles to deploy. It is up to the handler at this address to assign those deployments to specific Vert.x instances or otherwise handle deployments via the Vert.x Container.
        context - The context of the network to shutdown.
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called once the network has been shutdown.
        Returns:
        The called Vertigo instance.
